intro: Schoberia tortuosa, commonly known as the twisted spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, meandering stems that often twist and curl. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine, white hairs. Schoberia tortuosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
